GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 15, 2025
James Risinger
MONROE COUNTY YOUTH CENTER
3600 S CUSTER RD,
MONROE, MI, 48161-9058
Re: License #: CO580201307
Dear Mr. Risinger:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
9/15/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving the license
in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move,
please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
• There was no consultation requested or required.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency was found in violation of Ruel 400.10157 Health Services (1)(a) for Special
Investigation #CO580201307. The CAP contained one violation for a nurse failing
to follow the facility’s procedure regarding obtaining parental consent prior to
starting a youth on a psychotropic medication. The facility updated a new policy
that was implemented regarding psychotropic medication. The nurse will also
complete a checklist to ensure compliance of parental consent for new or adjusted
psychotropic medications.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting for the facility was provided by the overseeing organization and
no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection, and no issues or concerns
were raised. Chief Administrator reported that hiring additional/qualified staff has
been a struggle for the past two years. Staff reported they feel supported by their
direct supervisor. Staff also reported there aren't any changes they would make
about the program, and they care about the youth and their well-being.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection, and no issues or concerns
were raised. Each youth reported their favorite food and staff member. All youth
reported staff are good, and they wouldn't change anything about the program. All
youth also reported they understand the grievance procedure.
3

Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on September 15th,
2025. There were no issues or safety concerns noted. The facility was well
maintained, clean, and well organized. All bedrooms in use had appropriate
bedding. The bathrooms were viewed to have running water, working toilets,
working sinks and working showers.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
